keyTakeAways: A federal judge in Chicago has raised serious concerns that federal immigration enforcement agents are not complying with her order to avoid the use of tear gas and less-lethal munitions during protests.
The judge issued a sweeping order restricting the use of force, requiring body-worn cameras, and mandating transparency in actions taken against protesters and journalists.
Agents involved in Operation Midway Blitz have been found to have deployed tear gas and pepper balls without warning, prompting judicial intervention.
The Trump administration has defended its actions, denying reports of tear gas use without warning, though officials acknowledged they have not personally seen such incidents.
The judge has demanded accountability from key officials, including Russell Hott and Gregory Bovino, who were initially required to appear but have been deferred to a later deposition.
Protests continue at the Broadview ICE facility, with over 100 demonstrators gathering and more than 30 arrests reported in recent days.
The judge emphasized that body-worn cameras are critical for documenting events before the use of force and ensuring compliance with her directives.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A federal judge in Chicago, Sara Ellis, has raised serious concerns that federal immigration agents under Operation Midway Blitz are violating her order to avoid using tear gas and less-lethal force during protests, particularly in the Albany Park neighborhood and at the Broadview ICE facility. The judge, an Obama appointee, required body-worn cameras and transparency in crowd control tactics, but reports of tear gas use without warning have prompted her to demand accountability from officials such as Russell Hott and Gregory Bovino. Despite the Trump administration’s denials and claims of compliance, officials like Kyle Harvick and Shawn Byers testified, with Harvick affirming camera use and Byers stating no disciplinary actions have occurred. The protests continue, with over 30 arrests reported, and the judge has indicated she will require further testimony if officials fail to provide clear, verifiable answers.
title: Federal Officials Defend Themselves as Judge Demands Answers Over ICE Protest Tactics in Chicago
